required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multicentre, Prospective, Double Blind, Randomised, Placebo Controlled Study, Assessing the Efficacy and Safety of Dysport® Intramuscular Injections Used for the Treatment of Upper Limb Spasticity in Adult Subjects With Spastic Hemiparesis Due to Stroke or Traumatic Brain Injury

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to assess the efficacy of Dysport compared to placebo in improving muscle tone in hemiparetic subjects with upper limb spasticity due to stroke or traumatic brain injury.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in MAS Score in the Primary Targeted Muscle Group (PTMG)
primary_outcome.description: MAS scale is used to assess muscle tone using a 6-point scale where: 0=No increase in muscle tone, 1=Slight increase in muscle tone manifested by a catch and release or by minimal resistance at the end of the range of motion (ROM) when the part is flexed or extended, 1±Slight increase in muscle tone manifested by a catch followed by minimal resistance throughout the remainder of the ROM, 2=Marked increase in muscle tone through most of the ROM but affected part easily moved, 3=Considerable increase in muscle tone passive movement difficult or 4=Affected part(s) rigid in flexion or extension. The MAS has been derived for analyses as follows: 0=0 ; 1=1; 1+=2; 2=3; 3=4 and 4=5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) of Treatment Response
secondary_outcome.description: PGA is a 9-point scale used to assess global overall treatment response by the investigator (-4: markedly worse, -3: much worse, -2: worse, -1: slightly worse, 0: no change, +1: slightly improved, +2: improved, +3: much improved and +4: markedly improved).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in DAS Score for the Principal Target of Treatment (PTT)
secondary_outcome.description: DAS is a 4-point scale used to determine the extent of functional impairment in 4 functional domains (dressing, hygiene, limb position and pain). DAS scale rating: 0=No disability, 1=Mild disability (noticeable but does not interfere significantly with normal activities), 2=Moderate disability (normal activities require increased effort and/or assistance) and 3=Severe disability (normal activities limited). If subject chose 'Hygiene' as PTT the score collected will be between 0 and 3.

intervention.description: 500 U, I.M. (in the muscle) injection on day 1 of a single treatment cycle.
1000 U, I.M. (in the muscle) injection on day 1 of a single treatment cycle.
I.M. (in the muscle) injection on day 1 of a single treatment cycle.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients - post stroke or brain injury
- Modified Ashworth Scale ≥ 2
- Ambulatory patients
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous treatment with botulinum toxin of any type within 4 months prior to study entry for any condition
- Physiotherapy initiated less than 4 weeks before inclusion
- Previous surgery, alcohol, phenol in upper limb
- Neurological/neuromuscular disorders which may interfere with protocol evaluations

facility.name: Rancho Los Amigos National Rehabilitation Center
Associated Neurologist of Southern CT, PT
Parkinson's Disease & Movement Disorders Center of Boca Raton
Univ of North Carolina - Chapel Hill
University of Utah School of Medicine
Université catholique de Louvain av Hippocrate 10
Centre Hospitalier Albert Chenevier-Hopital Henri Mondor
Scientific Center of Neurology of RAMS

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This multicenter study was conducted in 34 investigational sites. Subjects screened were 281 and randomised and treated were 243.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo intramuscular injection single treatment cycle on day 1

group.title: Dysport 500 U
group.description: Botulinum type A toxin (Dysport) 500 U intramuscular injection single treatment cycle on day 1

group.title: Dysport 1000 U
group.description: Botulinum type A toxin (Dysport) 1000 U intramuscular injection single treatment cycle on day 1

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Family reason and moved out of state

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo intramuscular injection single treatment cycle on day 1

group.title: Dysport 500 U
group.description: Botulinum type A toxin (Dysport) 500 U intramuscular injection single treatment cycle on day 1

group.title: Dysport 1000 U
group.description: Botulinum type A toxin (Dysport) 1000 U intramuscular injection single treatment cycle on day 1

measure.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: Placebo: N=78, Dysport 500 U: N=80, and Dysport 1000 U: N=80.

measure.title: Modified Ashworth Scale (MAS)
measure.description: MAS scale is used to assess muscle tone (MT) using a 6-point scale where:0=No increase in MT, 1=Slight increase in MT,1±=Slight increase in MT manifested by a catch followed by minimal resistance throughout remainder of ROM,2=Marked increase in MT through most of ROM but affected part easily moved,3=Considerable increase in MT passive movement difficult or 4=Affected part(s) rigid in flexion or extension. The MAS has been derived for analyses as follows: 0=0 ; 1=1; 1+=2; 2=3; 3=4 and 4=5. Placebo:N=79, Dysport 500U:N=80 & Dysport 1000U:N=79.

measure.title: Disability Assessment Scale (DAS)
measure.description: DAS is a 4-point scale used to determine the extent of functional impairment in 4 functional domains (dressing, hygiene, limb position and pain). DAS scale rating: 0=No disability, 1=Mild disability (noticeable but does not interfere significantly with normal activities), 2=Moderate disability (normal activities require increased effort and/or assistance) and 3=Severe disability (normal activities limited). If the subject chose Hygiene as PTT the score collected will be between 0 and 3. Placebo: N=79, Dysport 500 U: N=80 and Dysport 1000 U: N=79.

outcome.title: Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) of Treatment Response
outcome.description: PGA is a 9-point scale used to assess global overall treatment response by the investigator (-4: markedly worse, -3: much worse, -2: worse, -1: slightly worse, 0: no change, +1: slightly improved, +2: improved, +3: much improved and +4: markedly improved).
outcome.population: ITT population. Two subjects each from Placebo and Dysport 1000 U had missed PGA assessment at week 4

measure.title: Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) of Treatment Response
measure.description: PGA is a 9-point scale used to assess global overall treatment response by the investigator (-4: markedly worse, -3: much worse, -2: worse, -1: slightly worse, 0: no change, +1: slightly improved, +2: improved, +3: much improved and +4: markedly improved).
measure.population: ITT population. Two subjects each from Placebo and Dysport 1000 U had missed PGA assessment at week 4

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in DAS Score for the Principal Target of Treatment (PTT)
outcome.description: DAS is a 4-point scale used to determine the extent of functional impairment in 4 functional domains (dressing, hygiene, limb position and pain). DAS scale rating: 0=No disability, 1=Mild disability (noticeable but does not interfere significantly with normal activities), 2=Moderate disability (normal activities require increased effort and/or assistance) and 3=Severe disability (normal activities limited). If subject chose 'Hygiene' as PTT the score collected will be between 0 and 3.
outcome.population: ITT population. Two subjects each from Placebo and Dysport 1000 U had missed DAS assessment at baseline and week 4.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo intramuscular injection single treatment cycle on day 1

group.description: Botulinum type A toxin (Dysport) 1000 U intramuscular injection single treatment cycle on day 1

measure.title: Change From Baseline in DAS Score for the Principal Target of Treatment (PTT)
measure.description: DAS is a 4-point scale used to determine the extent of functional impairment in 4 functional domains (dressing, hygiene, limb position and pain). DAS scale rating: 0=No disability, 1=Mild disability (noticeable but does not interfere significantly with normal activities), 2=Moderate disability (normal activities require increased effort and/or assistance) and 3=Severe disability (normal activities limited). If subject chose 'Hygiene' as PTT the score collected will be between 0 and 3.
measure.population: ITT population. Two subjects each from Placebo and Dysport 1000 U had missed DAS assessment at baseline and week 4.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in MAS Score in the Primary Targeted Muscle Group (PTMG)
outcome.description: MAS scale is used to assess muscle tone using a 6-point scale where: 0=No increase in muscle tone, 1=Slight increase in muscle tone manifested by a catch and release or by minimal resistance at the end of the range of motion (ROM) when the part is flexed or extended, 1±Slight increase in muscle tone manifested by a catch followed by minimal resistance throughout the remainder of the ROM, 2=Marked increase in muscle tone through most of the ROM but affected part easily moved, 3=Considerable increase in muscle tone passive movement difficult or 4=Affected part(s) rigid in flexion or extension. The MAS has been derived for analyses as follows: 0=0 ; 1=1; 1+=2; 2=3; 3=4 and 4=5.
outcome.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population included all randomized subjects who received at least one injection of study drug and had a MAS score at baseline (pretreatment) and at week 4. Total 5 subjects were excluded from ITT population as they did not have MAS score at baseline or/and at week 4.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
